intro: Chlorophytum macropodum, commonly known as the Tiger's Tail, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its long, grass-like leaves that are often striped with white and green, giving it a striking appearance. The plant produces small, white, star-shaped flowers in summer, which are borne on thin, erect stems. It is a hardy, drought-tolerant species that thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. Chlorophytum macropodum is popular as a ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care.
